sentences: Georg Carl Bohlmann   (8 April 1838 – 1920) was a Danish music teacher, music director, organist and composer.
The son of tobacco manufacturers, Bohlmann received his musical training in Bremen, where he stayed from 1851–1859 and was educated under Carl Heinemann.
He returned to Copenhagen, where he worked as a music teacher and organizer, and as music director at theaters.
